page.title: 10The "Boar Inn" at Gt.Ryburgh
page.content: {The Boar}is on a corner opposite the Parish Church, and probably dates from the 13th C, though the present front is 18th C. Formerly called the "Blue Boar" from a boar in the coat of arms of the deVere family, it changed hands in 1777 for Â£300. The present landlord has been there for 3 years.{ The restaurant,}which provides about half the business, serves lunch and dinner. {Bed and {breakfast}accomodation is also available at Â£12.50 per night. Opening hours are 10.30am to 2.30pm and 6.00pm to 11.00pm. Children are allowed in if accompanied by parents. The pleasant garden with tables and chairs is popular in the summer. Only about 15% of the customers are from Great Ryburgh itself.
